member.name: T:Primavera.Hydrogen.Telemetry.Azure.AzureInsightsTelemetryOptions
member.summary: Defines the options used to configure new instances.

member.name: P:Primavera.Hydrogen.Telemetry.Azure.AzureInsightsTelemetryOptions.ConnectionString
member.summary: Gets or sets the connection string to connect to the service. Without the instrumentation key the telemetry will not be collected.

member.name: P:Primavera.Hydrogen.Telemetry.Azure.AzureInsightsTelemetryOptions.Enabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether telemetry is enabled. The default value is true.

member.name: P:Primavera.Hydrogen.Telemetry.Azure.AzureInsightsTelemetryOptions.IgnoreErrors
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether any error raised by the telemetry features should be ignored (not thrown). Default value is true.

member.name: P:Primavera.Hydrogen.Telemetry.Azure.AzureInsightsTelemetryOptions.DeveloperMode
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether telemetry should be collected in developer mode. The default value is false. When true the telemetry is expedited through the pipeline immediately.

member.name: P:Primavera.Hydrogen.Telemetry.Azure.AzureInsightsTelemetryOptions.EnableAdaptiveSampling
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether adaptive sampling is enabled. The default value is false.

member.name: P:Primavera.Hydrogen.Telemetry.Azure.AzureInsightsTelemetryOptions.EnableDependencyTracking
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether dependency tracking is enabled. The default value is true.

member.name: P:Primavera.Hydrogen.Telemetry.Azure.AzureInsightsTelemetryOptions.EnableRequestTracking
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether request tracking is enabled. The default value is true.

member.name: P:Primavera.Hydrogen.Telemetry.Azure.AzureInsightsTelemetryOptions.EnableDiagnostics
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether diagnostics telemetry is enabled. The default value is true.

member.name: P:Primavera.Hydrogen.Telemetry.Azure.AzureInsightsTelemetryOptions.EnablePerformanceCounterCollection
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether collection of performance counters is enabled. The default value is true.

member.name: P:Primavera.Hydrogen.Telemetry.Azure.AzureInsightsTelemetryOptions.DefaultProperties
member.summary: Gets or sets a dictionary containing the properties that should be added to telemetry requests.

member.name: P:Primavera.Hydrogen.Telemetry.Azure.AzureInsightsTelemetryOptions.RequestTracking
member.summary: Gets or sets additional request tracking options.

member.name: P:Primavera.Hydrogen.Telemetry.Azure.AzureInsightsTelemetryOptions.DependencyTracking
member.summary: Gets or sets additional dependency tracking options.

member.name: P:Primavera.Hydrogen.Telemetry.Azure.AzureInsightsTelemetryOptions.ExceptionTracking
member.summary: Gets or sets additional exception tracking options.

member.name: P:Primavera.Hydrogen.Telemetry.Azure.AzureInsightsTelemetryOptions.TelemetryChannel
member.summary: Gets or sets the concrete telemetry channel that should be used. The default value is null. If null, the default telemetry channel will be used.

member.name: T:Primavera.Hydrogen.Telemetry.Azure.Initializers.DefaultPropertiesTelemetryInitializer
member.summary: Defines a telemetry initializer (see ) that ensures the telemetry items context includes the global properties specified in .
member.remarks: This type should be registered as a singleton before . This telemetry initializer is configured by default in .

member.name: M:Primavera.Hydrogen.Telemetry.Azure.Initializers.DefaultPropertiesTelemetryInitializer.#ctor(Primavera.Hydrogen.Telemetry.Azure.AzureInsightsTelemetryOptions)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: T:Primavera.Hydrogen.Telemetry.Azure.Initializers.Dependencies.ConflictStatusCodeDependencyTelemetryInitializer
member.summary: Defines a dependency telemetry initializer (see ) that allows setting the telemetry as success for a specific command when the status code is .
member.remarks:
By default, Application Insights will treat 409 dependencies as failures and that may trigger alerts and other healing mechanisms that will not be correct/effective when the application is expected to receive those responses. Changing the dependency telemetry result (success/failure) based on the dependency status code allows to change that behavior. This type should be registered as a singleton before . This telemetry initializer is configured by default if is not empty, in
to ignore the dependencies that match the specified commands.
member.example:
To set all dependencies to success, regardless of the dependency command:
services.AddSingleton<ITelemetryInitializer, ConflictStatusCodeDependencyTelemetryInitializer>();

member.name: M:Primavera.Hydrogen.Telemetry.Azure.Initializers.Dependencies.ConflictStatusCodeDependencyTelemetryInitializer.#ctor(System.IServiceProvider)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: T:Primavera.Hydrogen.Telemetry.Azure.Initializers.Dependencies.DependencyTelemetryInitializer
member.summary: Defines the base class for telemetry initializers (see ) that handle dependencies telemetry.

member.name: P:Primavera.Hydrogen.Telemetry.Azure.Initializers.Dependencies.DependencyTelemetryInitializer.Dependencies
member.summary: Gets or sets how the initializer should track dependencies.
member.remarks: If the initializer will not be executed for any dependency. If the initializer will be executed for all dependencies. If the initializer will be executed for the dependencies whose command match the specified .

member.name: P:Primavera.Hydrogen.Telemetry.Azure.Initializers.Dependencies.DependencyTelemetryInitializer.Commands
member.summary: Gets or sets the list of commands for which the initializer will be executed. Commands will match if they contain the specified values (case insensitive).
member.remarks: Only meaningful if is .
member.example: Specify blob.core.windows.net to match any dependency on Azure Blob Storage.

member.name: P:Primavera.Hydrogen.Telemetry.Azure.Initializers.Dependencies.DependencyTelemetryInitializer.ServiceProvider
member.summary: Gets the service provider.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.summary: Determines whether the telemetry initializer should be executed for the specified dependency telemetry.
member.returns: A value indicating whether the telemetry initializer should be executed for the specified request telemetry.
member.remarks: This method is called by to determine whether should be called. The default behavior is to check if dependency command matches one of the specified.

member.name: M:Primavera.Hydrogen.Telemetry.Azure.Initializers.Dependencies.DependencyTelemetryInitializer.InitializeCore(Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.DataContracts.DependencyTelemetry)
member.summary: Executes the dependency initializer for the specified dependency telemetry.

member.name: T:Primavera.Hydrogen.Telemetry.Azure.Initializers.Dependencies.DependencyTelemetryInitializerBehavior
member.summary: Defines the behavior of a .

member.name: F:Primavera.Hydrogen.Telemetry.Azure.Initializers.Dependencies.DependencyTelemetryInitializerBehavior.All
member.summary: The initializer will be executed for all dependencies.

member.name: F:Primavera.Hydrogen.Telemetry.Azure.Initializers.Dependencies.DependencyTelemetryInitializerBehavior.None
member.summary: The initializer will not be executed for any dependencies.

member.name: F:Primavera.Hydrogen.Telemetry.Azure.Initializers.Dependencies.DependencyTelemetryInitializerBehavior.Specified
member.summary: The initializer will be executed only for the dependencies whose command match the specified commands.

member.name: T:Primavera.Hydrogen.Telemetry.Azure.Initializers.Dependencies.NotFoundStatusCodeDependencyTelemetryInitializer
member.summary: Defines a dependency telemetry initializer (see ) that allows setting the telemetry as success for a specific command when the status code is .
member.remarks:
By default, Application Insights will treat 404 dependencies as failures and that may trigger alerts and other healing mechanisms that will not be correct/effective when the application is expected to receive those responses. Changing the dependency telemetry result (success/failure) based on the dependency status code allows to change that behavior. This type should be registered as a singleton before . This telemetry initializer is configured by default if is not empty, in
to ignore the dependencies that match the specified commands.
member.example:
To set all dependencies to success, regardless of the dependency command:
services.AddSingleton<ITelemetryInitializer, NotFoundStatusCodeDependencyTelemetryInitializer>();

member.name: M:Primavera.Hydrogen.Telemetry.Azure.Initializers.Dependencies.NotFoundStatusCodeDependencyTelemetryInitializer.#ctor(System.IServiceProvider)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: T:Primavera.Hydrogen.Telemetry.Azure.Initializers.Dependencies.StatusCodeDependencyTelemetryInitializer
member.summary: Defines the base class for dependency telemetry initializers (see ) that allows setting the telemetry as success based on a given status code for a specific command.

member.name: P:Primavera.Hydrogen.Telemetry.Azure.Initializers.Dependencies.StatusCodeDependencyTelemetryInitializer.StatusCode
member.summary: Gets the status code for which the dependencies will be set as success.

member.name: M:Primavera.Hydrogen.Telemetry.Azure.Initializers.Dependencies.StatusCodeDependencyTelemetryInitializer.#ctor(System.IServiceProvider,System.Net.HttpStatusCode)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The status code for which the dependencies will be set as success.

member.name: T:Primavera.Hydrogen.Telemetry.Azure.Initializers.Requests.ConflictStatusCodeRequestTelemetryInitializer
member.summary: Defines a request telemetry initializer (see ) that allows setting a request as success for a specific request path when the status code is .
member.remarks:
By default, Application Insights will treat 409 responses as failures and that may trigger alerts and other healing mechanisms that will not be correct/effective when the application is expected to return those responses (like is the case of REST API routes). Changing the request telemetry result (success/failure) based on the response status code allows to change that behavior. This type should be registered as a singleton before . This telemetry initializer is configured by default if is not empty, in
to ignore all requests that have a result of .
member.example:
To set all responses to success, regardless of the request path:
services.AddSingleton<ITelemetryInitializer, ConflictStatusCodeRequestTelemetryInitializer>();

member.name: M:Primavera.Hydrogen.Telemetry.Azure.Initializers.Requests.ConflictStatusCodeRequestTelemetryInitializer.#ctor(System.IServiceProvider)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: T:Primavera.Hydrogen.Telemetry.Azure.Initializers.Requests.HeadersRequestTelemetryInitializer
member.summary: Defines the base class for request telemetry initializers (see ) that initialize properties based on headers.

member.name: P:Primavera.Hydrogen.Telemetry.Azure.Initializers.Requests.HeadersRequestTelemetryInitializer.Headers
member.summary: Gets or sets how the initializer should track headers. The default value is .
member.remarks: If the initializer will not track any header. If the initializer will track all headers. If the initializer will track only the headers whose name match the specified .

member.name: P:Primavera.Hydrogen.Telemetry.Azure.Initializers.Requests.HeadersRequestTelemetryInitializer.HeaderNames
member.summary: Gets or sets the list of the names of the headers that the initializer should track. Header names will match if they contain the specified values (case insensitive).
member.remarks: Only meaningful if is .

member.name: M:Primavera.Hydrogen.Telemetry.Azure.Initializers.Requests.HeadersRequestTelemetryInitializer.#ctor(System.IServiceProvider)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: T:Primavera.Hydrogen.Telemetry.Azure.Initializers.Requests.HeadersRequestTelemetryInitializerBehavior
member.summary: Defines the behavior of a .

member.name: F:Primavera.Hydrogen.Telemetry.Azure.Initializers.Requests.HeadersRequestTelemetryInitializerBehavior.All
member.summary: The initializer will track all headers.

member.name: F:Primavera.Hydrogen.Telemetry.Azure.Initializers.Requests.HeadersRequestTelemetryInitializerBehavior.None
member.summary: The initializer will not track any headers.

member.name: F:Primavera.Hydrogen.Telemetry.Azure.Initializers.Requests.HeadersRequestTelemetryInitializerBehavior.Specified
member.summary: The initializer will track only the headers whose name match the specified header names.

member.name: T:Primavera.Hydrogen.Telemetry.Azure.Initializers.Requests.NotFoundStatusCodeRequestTelemetryInitializer
member.summary: Defines a request telemetry initializer (see ) that allows setting a request as success for a specific request path when the status code is .
member.remarks:
By default, Application Insights will treat 404 responses as failures and that may trigger alerts and other healing mechanisms that will not be correct/effective when the application is expected to return those responses (like is the case of Web API routes). Changing the request telemetry result (success/failure) based on the response status code allows to change that behavior. This type should be registered as a singleton before . This telemetry initializer is configured by default if is not empty, in
to ignore all requests that have a result of .
member.example:
To set all responses to success, regardless of the request path:
services.AddSingleton<ITelemetryInitializer, NotFoundStatusCodeRequestTelemetryInitializer>();

member.name: M:Primavera.Hydrogen.Telemetry.Azure.Initializers.Requests.NotFoundStatusCodeRequestTelemetryInitializer.#ctor(System.IServiceProvider)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: T:Primavera.Hydrogen.Telemetry.Azure.Initializers.Requests.RequestHeadersRequestTelemetryInitializer
member.summary: Defines a request telemetry initializer (see ) that allows collecting request headers.
member.remarks:
This type should be registered as a singleton before . This telemetry initializer is configured by default, if is not empty, in
to track all request headers for all requests.
member.example:
To track all request headers for all requests:
services.AddSingleton<ITelemetryInitializer, RequestHeadersRequestTelemetryInitializer>();

member.name: M:Primavera.Hydrogen.Telemetry.Azure.Initializers.Requests.RequestHeadersRequestTelemetryInitializer.#ctor(System.IServiceProvider)

member.remarks: Only meaningful if is .

To track all response headers for all requests:

member.name: T:Primavera.Hydrogen.Telemetry.Azure.Initializers.Requests.SyntheticSourceRequestTelemetryInitializer
member.summary: Defines a request telemetry initializer (see ) that allows setting the synthetic source of telemetry based on the user agent request header.
member.remarks: By default, Application Insights sets the SyntheticSource property to identify requests from robots and availability tests so they can be distinguished somehow (to ignore them for example). This initializer allows complementing that behavior by setting the property based on the user agent that is performing the requests. This type should be registered as a singleton before . This telemetry initializer is configured by default if is true, in .
member.example:
To set the synthetic source, regardless of the request path (using the default list of user agents):
services.AddSingleton<ITelemetryInitializer, SyntheticSourceRequestTelemetryInitializer>();

member.name: P:Primavera.Hydrogen.Telemetry.Azure.Initializers.Requests.SyntheticSourceRequestTelemetryInitializer.UserAgents
member.summary: Gets or sets the user agents that should be considered. User agents will match if they contain the specified values (case insensitive).
member.remarks: The default list includes: "Azure Traffic Manager Endpoint Monitor".

member.name: M:Primavera.Hydrogen.Telemetry.Azure.Initializers.Requests.SyntheticSourceRequestTelemetryInitializer.#ctor(System.IServiceProvider)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.summary: Provides a default implementation of .

member.summary: Defines an exception telemetry processor (see ) that enriches exception telemetry for exceptions of type by detecting if the exception resulted from HTTP request connections being aborted (client disconnecting).
member.remarks: This type should be registered AFTER . This telemetry processor is configured by default if is true, in .

member.name: M:Primavera.Hydrogen.Telemetry.Azure.Processors.Exceptions.ExceptionTelemetryProcessor.ShouldProcess(Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.DataContracts.ExceptionTelemetry,System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary{System.String,System.Object})
member.summary: Determines whether the telemetry initializer should be executed for the specified exception telemetry.
member.param: A property bag that can be used to share data while processing an exception telemetry item.

member.name: T:Primavera.Hydrogen.Telemetry.Azure.Processors.Requests.IgnoreAvailabilityRequestTelemetryProcessor
member.summary: Defines a request telemetry processor (see ) that prevents request telemetry resulting from availability tests from being collected.
member.remarks: This type should be registered AFTER . This telemetry processor is configured by default if is true, in .
member.example:
To ignore all availability tests requests, regardless of the request path:
services.AddApplicationInsightsTelemetryProcessor<IgnoreAvailabilityRequestTelemetryProcessor>();
